intro: Phagnalon nitidum, commonly known as the smooth phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Phagnalon nitidum is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
